data.title: Resume — Sarah Marks Design
data.text:
2015 – 2019

Hands-on product designer and leader.

Optimized the conversion of the main acquisition funnel through ongoing A/B tests of design and collaboration with the data analytics, engineering, and marketing teams.

Oversaw a rebrand of the site and introduced a "subscribe & save" feature for hair products clients.

Launched online salon booking, and created tools for colorists to formulate client's hair color.

Owned roadmap planning in support of the founders’ vision advocating for the user, and partnered closely with engineering leads on its successful delivery.

Led the first phase of localizing the site for the Spanish speaking audience in the U.S..

Hired and supported a team of product managers, designers, and copywriters including design reviews, 1:1s, and performance reviews.

Promoted from Senior Director of UX to VP of Product Management in 2017.

2011 – 2012

Oversaw the design and user experience of the official 2012 Oscar.com web site.

Collaborated with the contracted design agency, on feature definition, design direction, and IA.

Led design presentations for the Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences and Oscar show producers.

Managed input and requests from a varied group of internal and external stakeholders.

Supported a large team of production artists, ux designers, and motion artists.

Reorganized production artist workflow for greater efficiency by teaming them with specific producers and editors.

2007 – 2011

Led design for the global relaunch of Yahoo!'s top-ranked entertainment verticals.

Created reusable design patterns and systems that were used across all media products including database pages (like a movie, tv show, or personality), video galleries and photo galleries.

Collaborated with cross-functional teams on the long-term strategic planning and requirement definition for each site.

Partnered with User Researchers to define the goals, test structure, and prototypes for all usability testing.

Managed the design team of visual and interaction designers including project resourcing, career development, and performance reviews.

Promoted from Senior Manager to Director of User Experience Design.
